channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The new rules for startup hiring
item.description: We’re in a new era for startup hiring, six experts told Fortune.

item.title: Brian Niccol wants your Starbucks drink to be made within 4 minutes of ordering
item.description: Niccol said Starbucks was founded on customer experience, and wants to return the brand to a position of excellence.

item.title: ‘Made in the USA’ is a struggling brand

item.title: How big data and an A-list board turned struggling NYU Langone into a $14 billion hospital powerhouse
item.description: CEO Robert Grossman and board chair Frank Langone have turned NYU Langone into a top-performing health system, and multiplied revenue seven-fold.

item.title: This Is the Reason Why Employees Quit
item.description: Employees need to feel like they matter.

item.title: Why Businesses Are Leaning Into Partnerships to Scale
item.description: Smart companies are shifting from “build it ourselves” to “who can we partner with?” Here’s how leading firms are doing more, with less.

item.title: The Security Vulnerabilities to Watch for When You’re Vibe Coding
item.description: Vibe coding is powerful, but anyone using it should remember that it can also be risky.

item.title: AI is gutting the next generation of talent: In tech, job openings for new grads have already been halved
item.description: For many new graduates, the first rung of the corporate ladder is getting harder to reach.

item.title: Big Tech Is the Only Theme in the Stock Market
item.description: Four AI names account for the majority of the S&P 500’s gains this year.

item.title: Climate Change Is Supercharging the Case for More Seasonal Work
item.description: Extreme weather makes it even clearer than our energy levels vary throughout the year. Is making work more seasonal the solution?
